project-registry.name: Project Registry
project-registry.description: Central registry for project metadata, API keys, JIRA project keys, Confluence space keys, and GitHub repositories. Use this first to get project configuration.

authentication.note: Use admin token for mutations, no auth for queries

tools.name: list_projects
tools.description: List all registered projects

tools.name: get_project
tools.description: Get project by ID including JIRA project key, Confluence space key, GitHub repo, and API key

tools.name: create_project
tools.description: Create a new project with metadata (requires admin token)

tools.name: update_project
tools.description: Update existing project metadata (requires admin token)

tools.name: delete_project
tools.description: Delete project (requires admin token)

tools.name: validate_token
tools.description: Validate API token

enhanced-context.name: Enhanced Context MCP
enhanced-context.description: Intelligent context, template, and agent selection with 38 specialized agents (32 technical + 6 domain experts). Provides intent-based context loading, SDLC guidance, quality checks, common mistakes, and best practices. Domain agents for e-commerce, healthcare, fintech, CX design, privacy, and supply chain planning. Technical agents for code, security, cloud, deployment, and testing. USE THIS FIRST before creating any JIRA issues or documentation.

authentication.note: Use project API key from Project Registry

tools.name: load_enhanced_context
tools.description: Load intelligent contexts, templates, and agents based on task intent, scope, complexity, and domain focus. Supports intent-based analysis of natural language queries. Returns: epic prefix format, story structure, acceptance criteria, quality checks, common mistakes, best practices, SDLC guidance, agent persona, and templates.

parameters.query_type: Required. Type of query (story, testing, security, architecture, architecture-diagrams, pr-review, documentation, infrastructure, etc)
parameters.task_intent: Optional. What you want to do: create, refine, breakdown, review, plan, implement
parameters.scope: Optional. Work scope: epic, story, subtask, portfolio, theme, spike
parameters.complexity: Optional. Complexity level: simple, medium, complex, critical
parameters.output_format: Optional. Output destination: jira, confluence, github, gitlab
parameters.domain_focus: Optional. Domain areas needing attention: security, payments, compliance, performance, accessibility, data, infrastructure, api, frontend, backend
parameters.user_query: Optional. Original natural language query for semantic understanding
parameters.project_path: Optional. Project path (auto-detected if not provided)

tools.name: list_vishkar_agents
tools.description: List all available VISHKAR agent profiles. Filter by type: 'technical' (32 agents: code, security, cloud, deployment, testing), 'domain_expert' (6 agents: e-commerce, healthcare, fintech, CX, privacy, supply chain), or 'all' (38 total agents). Domain agents for planning, technical agents for implementation.

tools.name: load_vishkar_agent
tools.description: Load specific agent profile by ID with complete persona, expertise, and examples

tools.name: update_agent
tools.description: Update existing agent with learning improvements (cannot create new agents)

tools.name: validate_vishkar_agent_profile
tools.description: Validate agent profile format and completeness

tools.name: refresh_agent_cache
tools.description: Clear cached agent profiles and reload from disk

jira.name: JIRA MCP
jira.description: Complete JIRA management with 24 tools: create/update issues (epics, stories, tasks, subtasks, bugs), search with JQL, manage workflows, link dependencies, track time with worklogs, manage boards/sprints, search users, and query projects. Always use Enhanced Context MCP first to get proper epic prefix format and story structure before creating issues. NOTE: projectKey is now OPTIONAL - automatically fetched from Project Registry via API key.

authentication.note: Use project API key from Project Registry. Credentials, JIRA URL, and default projectKey are auto-fetched.

tools.name: search_issues
tools.description: Search JIRA issues using JQL (JIRA Query Language). Examples: "project = MYPROJ AND type = Epic", "Epic Link = MYPROJ-123", "assignee = currentUser() AND status != Done"

tools.name: get_issue
tools.description: Get JIRA issue details by key with specified fields

tools.name: create_issue
tools.description: Create JIRA issue (Epic, Story, Task, Subtask, Bug). For epics: use epic_name field. For stories: use epic_link to link to parent epic. For subtasks: use parent_key to link to parent story.

tools.name: update_issue
tools.description: Update existing JIRA issue fields including summary, description, status, assignee, labels, priority, and custom fields

tools.name: add_comment
tools.description: Add comment to JIRA issue

tools.name: transition_issue
tools.description: Transition issue to different status (To Do, In Progress, In Review, Done, Blocked)

tools.name: get_issue_transitions
tools.description: Get available transitions for an issue (workflow states)

tools.name: link_issues
tools.description: Link two JIRA issues with relationship type (blocks, relates to, depends on, duplicates, causes)

tools.name: get_issue_links
tools.description: Get all links for a specific issue (inward and outward links)

tools.name: get_dependency_tree
tools.description: Get complete dependency tree for an issue (recursive dependency graph)

tools.name: get_link_types
tools.description: Get available link types for the JIRA instance (blocks, relates to, etc.)

tools.name: get_boards
tools.description: Get all JIRA boards (Scrum, Kanban) with optional filters by type or name

tools.name: get_board_details
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific JIRA board by board ID

tools.name: get_board_issues
tools.description: Get all issues on a specific board with optional JQL filter

tools.name: get_current_user
tools.description: Get current authenticated user details (name, email, account ID)

tools.name: search_users
tools.description: Search JIRA users by query string (name, email) with configurable max results

tools.name: get_user_details
tools.description: Get detailed user information by account ID

tools.name: get_projects
tools.description: Get list of all JIRA projects accessible to the authenticated user

tools.name: get_project_details
tools.description: Get detailed project information by project key including components, versions, roles. NOTE: projectKey parameter is OPTIONAL - if not provided, uses default project from Project Registry.

tools.name: add_worklog
tools.description: Log time spent on an issue with optional comment and start date (ISO 8601 format)

tools.name: get_worklogs
tools.description: Get all time tracking worklogs for a specific issue

tools.name: get_server_info
tools.description: Get JIRA server information (version, build number, server time)

tools.name: create_sprint
tools.description: Create a new sprint for a board with optional start date, end date, and sprint goal

tools.name: update_sprint
tools.description: Update sprint properties (name, state, dates, goal) by sprint ID

confluence.name: Confluence MCP
confluence.description: Complete Confluence documentation management with 32 tools: spaces, pages, templates, attachments, folders, macros, labels, history, JIRA integration, and permissions. Upload documents, embed attachments, create page templates, insert JIRA macros, and manage page hierarchy. Use Enhanced Context MCP first to get proper documentation templates and structure. NOTE: spaceKey is now OPTIONAL - automatically fetched from Project Registry via API key.

authentication.note: Use project API key from Project Registry. Credentials, Confluence URL, and default spaceKey are auto-fetched.

tools.name: get_spaces
tools.description: Get list of all Confluence spaces

tools.name: get_space
tools.description: Get details of a specific Confluence space by key. NOTE: spaceKey parameter is OPTIONAL - if not provided, uses default space from Project Registry.

tools.name: get_content_by_id
tools.description: Get Confluence page content by page ID

tools.name: get_content_by_space_and_title
tools.description: Get Confluence page by space key and title. NOTE: spaceKey parameter is OPTIONAL - if not provided, uses default space from Project Registry.

tools.name: search
tools.description: Search Confluence content using CQL (Confluence Query Language). Examples: "type = page AND space = MYSP AND label = architecture", "title ~ Payment*", "created >= now(-7d)"

tools.name: create_page
tools.description: Create a new Confluence page with title, content (HTML storage format), optional parent_id for hierarchical structure, and labels. NOTE: spaceKey parameter is OPTIONAL - if not provided, uses default space from Project Registry.

tools.name: update_page
tools.description: Update an existing Confluence page content with version comment to track changes

tools.name: get_page_children
tools.description: Get child pages of a Confluence page (page hierarchy)

tools.name: get_page_attachments
tools.description: Get attachments for a Confluence page

tools.name: add_page_labels
tools.description: Add labels to a Confluence page for categorization and search

tools.name: upload_document
tools.description: Upload document or file as attachment to a Confluence page

tools.name: update_document
tools.description: Update existing document attachment with new version

tools.name: delete_document
tools.description: Delete document attachment by attachment ID

tools.name: list_documents
tools.description: List all documents/attachments in a Confluence space. NOTE: spaceKey parameter is OPTIONAL - if not provided, uses default space from Project Registry.

tools.name: create_folder
tools.description: Create folder (parent page) for organizing documentation hierarchy. NOTE: spaceKey parameter is OPTIONAL - if not provided, uses default space from Project Registry.

tools.name: get_folder_contents
tools.description: Get all child pages within a folder (parent page)

tools.name: move_page_to_folder
tools.description: Move page to different parent folder in hierarchy

tools.name: create_page_template
tools.description: Create reusable page template for consistent documentation. NOTE: spaceKey parameter is OPTIONAL - if not provided, uses default space from Project Registry.

tools.name: get_page_templates
tools.description: Get all available page templates in a space. NOTE: spaceKey parameter is OPTIONAL - if not provided, uses default space from Project Registry.

tools.name: apply_page_template
tools.description: Create new page from existing template. NOTE: spaceKey parameter is OPTIONAL - if not provided, uses default space from Project Registry.

tools.name: update_page_template
tools.description: Update existing page template content

tools.name: get_pages_by_label
tools.description: Find all pages tagged with specific label. NOTE: spaceKey parameter is OPTIONAL - if not provided, uses default space from Project Registry.

tools.name: get_page_history
tools.description: Get version history of page changes with authors and timestamps

tools.name: insert_macro
tools.description: Insert Confluence macro (status, info, warning, code, etc.) into page

tools.name: update_macro
tools.description: Update existing macro parameters on page

tools.name: get_page_macros
tools.description: List all macros present on a page

tools.name: link_page_to_jira_issue
tools.description: Add link from Confluence page to JIRA issue

tools.name: insert_jira_macro
tools.description: Insert JIRA macro to display issues using JQL query with custom display options

tools.name: get_space_permissions
tools.description: Get permission settings for a Confluence space. NOTE: spaceKey parameter is OPTIONAL - if not provided, uses default space from Project Registry.

tools.name: embed_existing_attachment
tools.description: Embed existing attachment as image or link in page content

tools.name: upload_and_embed_document
tools.description: Upload document and automatically embed it in page content

tools.name: upload_and_embed_attachment
tools.description: Upload file attachment and embed as image or link in one operation

storycrafter.name: StoryCrafter MCP
storycrafter.description: AI-powered backlog generator for VISHKAR 3-agent consensus discussions. Generates 6-8 comprehensive epics with 20-40 detailed user stories, complete with acceptance criteria, technical tasks, story points, and time estimates. Use this AFTER Enhanced Context MCP when you have consensus messages and need to create a complete project backlog.

authentication.note: No authentication required (service handles its own API keys)

tools.name: generate_backlog
tools.description: Generate complete project backlog from VISHKAR 3-agent consensus discussion (system, alex, blake, casey messages). Returns structured backlog with 6-8 epics, 20-40 stories, acceptance criteria in Given/When/Then format, technical implementation tasks, story points (Fibonacci scale), estimated hours, dependencies, tags, and MVP prioritization. Takes 30-60 seconds to generate.

tools.name: get_backlog_summary
tools.description: Extract summary statistics from a generated backlog: total epics, total stories, total hours, and breakdown by epic
